intro: Viola tricolor var. tenella, commonly known as the dwarf pansy, is a compact, low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive mottled pattern of green, white, and purple. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of violet, yellow, and white, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in cool climates and prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. This variety is often used in garden borders and containers due to its compact size and ornamental value.
